de.esoco.gwt.client.app

Class GwtApplicationPanelManager<C extends de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<C>
      • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerManager<C>
        • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.PanelManager<C,P>
          • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.AuthenticationPanelManager<C,P>
            • de.esoco.gwt.client.app.GwtApplicationPanelManager<C,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoginHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GwtApplicationTopPanelManager, GwtProcessAppRootPanel, ProcessPanelManager

    public abstract class GwtApplicationPanelManager<C extends de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends GwtApplicationPanelManager<?,?>>
extends AuthenticationPanelManager<C,P>
    An abstract base class for the panel managers of GWT applications. The default implementations of most methods always invoke the same method of the parent panel recursively. Therefore there must always be a subclass that serves as a root panel manager which overrides these methods and performs the actual action defined by the respective method.

    • Nested Class Summary

        Returns:

      • addProcessButtons

        protected void addProcessButtons(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<de.esoco.ewt.component.Panel> rBuilder,
                                 de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList rProcesses)
        Adds buttons for process descriptions to a panel. The panel should have been created with PanelManager.addToolbar(ContainerBuilder, de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData, de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData, int).
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The container builder to add the buttons with
        rProcesses - The process descriptions

      • appendToWindowTitle

        protected void appendToWindowTitle(java.lang.String sText)
        Appends a certain text to the window title.
        Parameters:
        sText -

      • displayProcess

        protected void displayProcess(de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        This method must be implemented by a panel manager in a panel manager hierarchy to display the result of a process execution. This method will be invoked by executeProcess(String, DataElement). The default implementation invokes the parent method if a parent exists.
        Parameters:
        rProcessState - The process state returned by the process execution

      • executeApplicationProcess

        protected void executeApplicationProcess(java.lang.String sProcessName)
        Executes the application process with a certain name.
        Parameters:
        sProcessName - rUserData The user data to read the process from

      • executeMainApplicationProcess

        protected void executeMainApplicationProcess()
        Executes the main application process.

      • executeProcess

        protected void executeProcess(java.lang.String sProcessName,
                              de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?> rProcessInput)
        Executes a certain process on the server.
        Parameters:
        sProcessName - The name of the process to execute
        rProcessInput - The ID of the currently selected entity or -1 for none

      • findElement

        protected java.lang.String findElement(de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList rList,
                                       java.lang.String sElement)
        Helper method to lookup a certain data element in a list of elements and to return it's value as a string.
        Parameters:
        rList - The list of data elements
        sElement - The name of the element to return the value of
        Returns:
        A string describing the element value

      • getProcessContainer

        protected C getProcessContainer()
        Can be overridden by subclasses to return the container in which the result of a process execution will be displayed. This will be used by the method setClientSize(ProcessDescription) to calculate the correct size of the client area. If not overridden the container of this panel will be returned.
        Returns:
        The process container

      • getProcessGroup

        protected java.lang.String getProcessGroup()
        Can be overridden by subclasses to return a specific process group that will be prepended to the names of processes to be executed. The default implementation returns NULL.
        Returns:
        The process group name

      • getSelectedElement

        protected de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?> getSelectedElement()
        This method can be overridden by subclasses that support the selection of elements. The implementation must return the a data element that describes the currently selected element or NULL if no selection is available. This method will be invoked from the event handler set by addProcessButtons(ContainerBuilder, DataElementList). The default implementation always returns NULL.
        Returns:
        A data element describing the currently selected element or NULL 1 for no selection

      • getSelectedEntityId

        protected de.esoco.data.element.IntegerDataElement getSelectedEntityId(de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?> rDataElement)
        Helper method that creates an integer data element containing the ID of a currently selected entity from a selection data element.
        Parameters:
        rDataElement - The data element to read the selection from
        Returns:
        A new integer data element for the current selection or NULL if no entity is selected

      • getUserData

        protected de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList getUserData()
        Returns the client-specific data for the currently authenticated user. This call is forwarded to the parent manager so that it must be implemented by the root panel manager.
        Returns:
        The user data or NULL if no user has been authenticated

      • logout

        protected void logout()
        Performs a logout of the current user. This call is forwarded to the parent manager so that it must be implemented by the root panel manager.

      • processFinished

        protected void processFinished(PanelManager<?,?> rProcessPanelManager,
                               de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        Will be invoked by the ProcessPanelManager after a process has finished execution. The standard implementation simply invokes the parent panel manger's method if a parent is available. The handling is typically implemented in the root of the panel hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        rProcessPanelManager - The manager of the causing panel
        rProcessState - The last state of the finished process

      • processUpdated

        protected void processUpdated(PanelManager<?,?> rPanelManager,
                              de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        Will be invoked by the ProcessPanelManager after a process has updated it's state, typically when it stops for an interaction. The standard implementation simply invokes the parent panel manger's method if a parent is available. The handling is typically implemented in the root of the panel hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        rPanelManager - The manager of the causing panel
        rProcessState - The current process state

      • setClientSize

        protected void setClientSize(de.esoco.data.process.ProcessDescription rProcessDescription)
        Sets the current size of the user's client (the web browser) into the given process description.
        Parameters:
        rProcessDescription -

      • setProcessButtonStates

        protected void setProcessButtonStates(boolean bHasSelection)
        Sets the process button states depending on the process requirement for an input value and the current selection state of this panel.
        Parameters:
        bHasSelection - nEntityId The ID of the selected entity or -1 for none
